answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Hi Nick,
Most organizations use track changes to provide collaborative reviews of documents. If you're not familiar with the term, it's an MS Word feature that allows you to change, edit and comment on sections of a document while leaving the author the option of either accepting those changes, responding to them or rejecting them. Please see this tutorial on YouTube for a complete walk-through: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sfrd_YcBdak
This is, to my knowledge, the best and most commonly practiced form of collaborative review using MS Word. If you're looking for something else/more detailed, please let me know and I'll see if I can't find a resource for you. Good luck.
Derek Johnson
